title: Font ID: Cisco 2.0 Font
content:
What is this:

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/etchalon/198277350/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013105754/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/etchalon/198277350/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/etchalon/198277350/")

Its not Apex nor Section

Mikey :-)

 [‹ 2 calligraphic style fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013105754/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46775 "Go to previous forum topic") [Serif ID please ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013105754/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46776 "Go to next forum topic")
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content:
Hi Mike,

It reminds me of [Scala Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013105754/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_scala_sans_black/?sample_text=Cisco%20S(s)YsTE(M)s). The M was from another font?

EDIT: Nope, it is not Scala Sans. Sorry.

Hi Mikey,

I’d say it’s [Freight Sans Black Small Caps](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013105754/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/garagefonts/freight_sans_black_sc/?sample_text=Cisco%20Systems&sample_size=48) by [Joshua Darden](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013105754/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Joshua%252BDarden).  
F

WOW!!! Thank you Florian!

I didn’t know Freight even hnd this weight/style.

Thank you!
